ygData.subject: Re: Blackened Iron Bastard Sword?
ygData.msgSnippet: what lvl is the knight ... From: Paul Fogle  To: EQCheats@onelist.com  Date: Friday, July 16, 1999 11:46 AM Subject:
ygData.messageBody:
what lvl is the knight

-----Original Message-----
From: Paul Fogle <pfogle@...>
To: 'EQCheats@onelist.com' <EQCheats@onelist.com>
Date: Friday, July 16, 1999 11:46 AM
Subject: RE: [EQCheats] Blackened Iron Bastard Sword?


>From: Paul Fogle <pfogle@...>
>
> BIB is on the goblin Knight. At the bottom of the first
>ramp, you come to a door, a tunnel going left, and a tunnel going right.
Go
>right at the bottom. Follow left wall around, past the water, into the
nest
>room.. there's a spot on the wall.. either green or purple.. can't remember
>off hand. Anyway.. the Knight spawns there, but be warned, it's a VERY
RARE
>spawn.. I've been there waiting for 4 hrs and didn't see him.. Others say
>it's random, sometimes they can spawn back to back within a half hour..
>sometimes it takes up to 6 hours or so. He always has the sword though.
> As far as blackened pieces go, elite guards and up will drop
>them..
>
> Good luck,
> Needun Luve,
> Rogue of the Rathe.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Sean.Clark@...
>[mailto:Sean.Clark@...]
> Sent: Friday, July 16, 1999 9:26 AM
> To: EQCheats@onelist.com
> Subject: [EQCheats] Blackened Iron
>Bastard Sword?
>
> From: Sean.Clark@...
>
>
> Hiya all!
> I'm lookin for some info (*spoil* me,
>PLEASE!) on the BIBS. I know its in
> Runneyeye, but was looking for more
>specifics on the location, the MOB that
> carries it, group lvl needed to get to /
>obtain the sword, etc, etc. I
> haven't spent much time in Runneyeye...is it
>a good mid-level dungeon? it
> doesn't seem very crowded..which would be a
>NICE change after spending the
> last week in Unrest!
> Also, for those of you wise in the way of
>Runneyeye...what MOBs drop the
> Blackened Iron armor pieces? I know the AC
>isn't great, and it weighs a
> lot, but it looks very cool and I bet there
>is a market out there for that
> 'look'.
> Thanks in advance for your help!!
> Thoradin of Bristlebane
